name: The Songs of Afroman Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Afroman's song "Because I Got High" has its own music video. Which comedic duo appeared in the video?
questions.explanation:
Jay and Silent Bob.

	The song was featured on their 2001 movie "Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back". The song details everything Afroman meant to do before he got high, and the consequences that followed.

questions.text: According to the song "Girls", what kind of girl does Afroman not like?
questions.explanation:
He likes them all.

	Afroman loves the ladies! He doesn't care if they're tall, short, old, young, smart or dumb. He would even be open to dating women from different planets.

questions.text: In the song "Whack Rappers", which performer's music is called ignorant?
questions.correct: Lil' Jon and the East Side Boys
questions.explanation:
Lil' Jon and the East Side Boys.

	"I think Lil' Jon and the East Side Boys Is an ignorant, irritating bunch of noise!"

questions.text: In the song "Dopefiend", who was Afroman's designated driver?
questions.explanation:
Carolyn.

	"My designated driver was this girl, Her name was Carolyn. But I can't go home, because she just died From an overdose of heroin."

questions.text: In the song "Drive Better Drunk", when did Afroman start drinking alcohol?
questions.explanation:
When he was 12.

	"I don't know what you've been told, I've been drinking since twelve years old. Started drinking in '88 Hanging at the liquor store real, real late." Afroman seems to revel in his past alcoholic exploits. I don't share his enthusiasm for the stuff.

questions.text: Which activity is not mentioned in "Because I Got High"?
questions.explanation:
Getting married.

	Due to marijuana, Afroman did not clean his room, did not attend class and did not go to work. Afroman failed the class, lost his job, and still had a messy room.

questions.text: In the song "Whack Rappers", who is the worst rapper Afroman has heard?
questions.explanation:
Birdman.

	Bryan "Birdman" Williams is a rapper and a music producer. He founded the hip-hop label Cash Money Records in 1991 with his brother.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "Drive Better Drunk": "Don't grab my ______ when they party's over/ I drive better drunk than you do sober."
questions.explanation:
keys.

	In this song, Afroman boasts about his drinking skills. Prolific alcohol abuse is prominent in many of Afroman's songs. His liver must be ruined!

questions.text: In "You Ain't My Friend", what goes missing when people are in Afroman's car?
questions.explanation:
CDs.

	"You always talkin' but you never listenWhen you ride in my car CDs come up missin'!"

questions.text: In "Just My Paranoia", who was the man with a tie?
questions.explanation:
A Mormon.

	"Somebody's knockin' at my front doorSome guy in a shirt and tie Is it Homicide or FBI? Does he have a warrant for Joseph Foreman? Oh, you're a Mormon!" "Just My Paranoia" is about Afroman's paranoia as a result of going to jail.
